intro: Phreatia vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the islands of Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure and growth habits. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination. Phreatia vitiensis is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, showcasing adaptations typical of epiphytic and terrestrial orchids.
